summary: Completed frontend testing of Workflow Stepper feature. All 9 test cases passed. The visual workflow stepper correctly shows the 4-step journey (Epic Definition → Features → User Stories → Complete) with appropriate styling for completed, current, and upcoming steps.
passed_tests: Workflow Stepper appears on Epic Definition page (epic creation mode) showing 'Epic Definition' as current step with ring highlight
Workflow Stepper appears on Feature Planning page showing 'Features' as current step when features not all approved
Workflow Stepper shows 'User Stories' as current step on Story Planning page
Stepper shows checkmarks (green success color) for completed steps - Epic Definition shows checkmark on Feature Planning page
Stepper shows ring highlight for current step (ring-2 class with ring-offset)
Stepper shows muted color (bg-muted) for upcoming steps
Connection lines between steps change color based on completion status (bg-success for completed, bg-border for upcoming)
Back button on Story Planning navigates to Epic page (/epic/{epicId}) - not browser back
All 4 workflow steps visible: Epic Definition, Features, User Stories, Complete with descriptions
critical_code_review_comments: WorkflowStepper component correctly implements step status logic based on currentStep, featuresComplete, and storiesComplete props
Step styling uses appropriate Tailwind classes: bg-success for complete, ring-2 for current, bg-muted for upcoming
Connection lines between steps correctly change color based on step completion status
Stepper shows dynamic content: feature count on Features step, stories ready count on User Stories step
Back button on Story Planning uses navigate() to Epic page instead of browser history
All interactive elements have appropriate data-testid attributes for testing
